title: Proteas pummelled in Pune as India make history
text:
Cape Town - India have beaten the Proteas by an innings and 137 runs to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Test series.

Asked to follow-on at the start of the fourth day, South Africa lost regular wickets to be bowled out for 189 with Dean Elgar top-scoring on 48.

Once again Ravi Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja caused the Proteas batsmen trouble, with the two spinners picking up two and three wickets respectively.

Fast bowler Umesh Yadav chipped in with three wickets as well.

India have now won 11 home series' in a row, a record in Test cricket.

More to follow...
description: India have beaten the Proteas by an innings and 137 runs to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Test series
